Dewan DKI Setujui Pembelian Antivirus dan Perangkat IT Rp 12 Miliar
05 Nov 2019, 11:12 by Imam Hamdi, Martha Warta Silaban
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kepala Dinas Kependudukan dan Catatan Sipil DKI Jakarta Dhany Sukma mengatakan legislator menyetujui anggaran Rp 12 miliar untuk pembelian antivirus dan perangkat IT pada rancangan plafon anggaran 2020.
"Anggaran tidak dikurangi karena nilai manfaatnya signifikan untuk kebutuhan pelayanan," kata Dhany saat dihubungi, Selasa, 5 Oktober 2019.
Adapun rincian anggaran Rp 12 miliar tersebut untuk membeli lisensi perangkat lunak Microsoft Office sebesar Rp 4 miliar dan database Oracle senilai Rp 6,4 miliar. Sisanya, sebesar Rp 1,6 miliar untuk membeli lisensi antivirus.
Dhany menuturkan dalam pembahasan anggaran bersama Komisi A beberapa hari lalu, mereka akhirnya menyetujui anggaran yang diajukan Disdukcapil DKI. Nantinya, antivirus dan perangkat IT itu bakal digunakan untuk memproteksi data di komputer dari tingkat kelurahan, kecamatan, suku dinas sampai Disdukcapil DKI.
"Layanan terkait dengan sistem dan software harus dijaga karena pasti dampaknya ke layanan," ujarnya. "Jadi kami harus melindungi server di kantor pemerintahan. Sebab, kami ada program pengembangan online."
Fraksi Partai Solidaritas Indonesia sebelumnya menyorot pembengkakan anggaran pengadaan lisensi perangkat lunak dan antivirus yang tertuang dalam KUA-PPAS 2020. Di dalam Anggaran Pendapatan dan Belanja Daerah DKI 2019 anggaran licensi perangkat lunak dan antivirus hanya Rp 200 juta, dan meningkat hingga Rp 12 miliar dalam KUA-PPAS 2020.
"Kami akan perjelas dalam rapat komisi anggaran Rp 12 miliar itu untuk apa saja. Kenapa harus beli daripada sewa," kata anggota Fraksi PSI William Aditya Sarana di DPRD DKI, Kamis, 3 Oktober 2019.

DKI Council Approves Purchase of Antivirus and IT Devices Rp 12 Billion
05 Nov 2019, 11:12 by Imam Hamdi, Martha Warta Silaban
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Head of the Jakarta Population and Civil Registry Office Dhany Sukma said the legislator approved a budget of Rp 12 billion for the purchase of antivirus and IT equipment in the 2020 budget ceiling design.
"The budget is not reduced because the value of the benefits is significant for service needs," Dhany said when contacted on Tuesday, October 5, 2019.
The details of the Rp 12 billion budget are for purchasing Microsoft Office software licenses of Rp 4 billion and the Oracle database worth Rp 6.4 billion. The rest, amounting to Rp 1.6 billion to buy an antivirus license.
Dhany said that in discussing the budget with Commission A a few days ago, they finally agreed to the budget proposed by the Jakarta Disdukcapil. Later, antivirus and IT devices will be used to protect data on computers from the level of villages, sub-districts, ethnic groups to Jakarta Disdukcapil.
"Services related to systems and software must be maintained because the impact will certainly be on services," he said. "So we have to protect servers in government offices. Because, we have an online development program."
The Indonesian Solidarity Party fraction previously highlighted the swelling budget for procurement of software and antivirus licenses as set out in KUA-PPAS 2020. In the 2019 DKI Regional Revenue and Expenditure Budget the software and antivirus license budget was only Rp 200 million, and increased to Rp 12 billion in KUA -PPAS 2020.
"We will be clear in the Rp 12 billion budget commission meeting for anything. Why should we buy it rather than rent it," said PSI Faction member William Aditya Sarana at the DKI DPRD, Thursday, October 3, 2019.
